author: andschwa
body: Recent PowerShell TTYs on Windows require that `TERM=xterm` for PSReadLine to work properly. This may fix the same problem we see on Nano in #1080.

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body:
This doesn't make sense to me - TERM isn't a thing to either conhost nor .Net (on Windows - full or core).

Furthermore, PSReadLine more or less works in my quick test - there are some serious issues when I load my customizations, but the basics work.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: I promise, it was weird, but itwould print a new line for every character until TERM was set (on Windows, in some configurations). But I'm fine with closing until it repros again.

title: PSReadLine requires TERM=xterm on Windows
